def astype_nansafe(arr, dtype, copy: bool = True, skipna: bool = False):
    """
    Cast the elements of an array to a given dtype in a nan-safe manner.

    Parameters
    ----------
    arr : ndarray
    dtype : np.dtype
    copy : bool, default True
        If False, a view will be attempted but may fail, if
        e.g. the item sizes don't align.
    skipna: bool, default False
        Whether or not we should skip NaN when casting as a string-type.

    Raises
    ------
    ValueError
        The dtype was a datetime64/timedelta64 dtype, but it had no unit.
    """

    # dispatch on extension dtype if needed
    if isinstance(dtype, pd.CategoricalDtype):
        if np.nan in arr:
            return arr.astype(dtype)  # return as is if NaN exists
        else:
            return arr.astype(dtype).astype('Int64')

    if not isinstance(dtype, np.dtype):
        dtype = pd.array([], dtype=dtype).dtype

    if np.issubdtype(dtype, np.datetime64):
        if dtype.name in ("datetime64", "timedelta64"):
            dtype_str = f"{dtype.name}[ns]"
            msg = f"The '{dtype.name}' dtype has no unit. Please pass in '{dtype_str}' instead."
            raise ValueError(msg)

    return arr.astype(dtype, copy=True)
